meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points that receive equal amounts of sunlight
meanings.sent1: The isohel on the map shows where the sunlight is the same.
meanings.sent2: Meteorologists use isohels to understand sunlight distribution across regions.
meanings.sent3: The isohel on the map looked like a squiggly snake trying to catch the sun.
meanings.sent4: The isohel acted as a bridge connecting all the sunny spots on the map.
meanings.sent5: The isohel painted a clear picture of where the sunlight falls equally.

meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points that receive equal amounts of rainfall
meanings.sent1: Farmers rely on isohels to plan their crops where rain is the same.
meanings.sent2: The isohel indicates areas with similar rainfall levels on the map.
meanings.sent3: The isohel on the map looked like a curly ribbon made of raindrops.
meanings.sent4: The isohel acted as a barrier separating dry areas from those with rain.
meanings.sent5: The isohel made it easy to see where the rain falls evenly.
